thread.title: EastEnders favourites Mick and Whitney Carter move in together: 'She'll be his bit on the side'
thread.title_full: EastEnders favourites Mick and Whitney Carter move in together: 'She'll be his bit on the side'

author: Nicola Agius
title: EastEnders favourites Mick and Whitney Carter move in together: 'She'll be his bit on the side'
text:
Get soaps     
EastEnders favourites Mick and Whitney Carter are moving in together. 
The pair have previously both cheated on their partners twice before with each other. 
And despite their inappropriate relationship, the Queen Vic landlord thought it would be a good idea to ask his daughter-in-law to move in to his home. 
While his wife Linda is away nursing her sick mother, and after telling his son Lee to dump Whitney, Mick appears keen on growing closer to the Albert Square stunner. EastEnders favourites Mick and Whitney Carter are moving in together (Photo: BBC) Does Mick have ulterior motives? 
He made the proposal after revealing that she would have to move out of the home she shared with her estranged hubby. Read More Danny Dyer's 'bitter feud' with Steve McFadden denied as EastEnders praise 'respected' star 
And at first it appeared as though he made the gesture to stop Whitney from becoming homes - but EastEnders fans are convinced he has ulterior motives. 
Taking to Twitter, one wrote: "Well it's not like Whitney can afford the flat now that Lee's gone...but the way Mick was moving was shady AF #EastEnders." 
Another then posted: "Mick & Whitney continue to get closer now she's moving in. Hurry home Linda #Eastenders." The pair have kissed twice before (Photo: BBC) 
Moments later, a different viewer wrote: "Do you dare Whitney go near Mick keep your hands off. Linda come back quick #Eastenders." 
Shortly afterwards, another tweeted: "No wonder sly Mick wants Whitney to live in the Vic in #EastEnders. He wants her to be his saucy bit on the side." How will Linda react to her new roommate? (Photo: BBC) 
While some fans are not happy with the prospect of Mick and Whitney growing closer, others approve of a potenital romance. 
"Anyone else think mick and Whitney would be cute? #eastenders," one fan gushed. Mick told his son Lee to dump Whitney (Photo: BBC) 
Producers are keeping tight-lipped over what lies ahead for these two, so we'l have to tune in to find out. 
*EastEnders returns to BBC One on Thursday at 7.30pm Like us on Facebook
